content: It appears that polls leave markdown uninterpreted, so you can't use code in polls.
I'd love to use markdown in polls.

Thanks for the request! Zulip polls are a totally independent rendering system from the markdown processor, so getting markdown working in polls would require a bunch of custom work. It may be easier to build a small number of specific markdown features rather than enabling full markdown support.

Are there particular aspects of markdown in addition to code that would be most useful? (By code, do you have in mind the single-backtick syntax?)
It'd be nice if the same rendering engine worked everywhere, but I absolutely understand that that's a bigger ask. :)
In practice, it'd be helpful if code, links, italic, bold, and strikethrough all worked.
(and the latter three are less important than the former two)
Also emoji in colons (:+1:)
Any kind of paragraph-level rather than text-level formatting doesn't seem necessary; for instance, triple-backquotes, lists, tables, images, and similar don't need to work.
Linkifiers too, if possible :upside_down:
